intro: Esenbeckia attenuata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. Esenbeckia attenuata is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
